conclusion: To determine the friction force of block A on the slope when θ is changed to 30° and a smooth cylinder B with mass m is placed between A and the inclined plane.
Determine the friction coefficient from the initial condition (θ = 37°).
Calculate normal force N = Mg cos(37°) and frictional force f = Mg sin(37°).
Frictional force is given by f = μN, solve for μ: μ = tan(37°).
Given sin(37°) = 0.6 and cos(37°) = 0.8, calculate μ = 0.75.
Analyze the new setup with θ = 30° and cylinder B, total mass is 5m.
Determine the new normal force N' = 5mg cos(30°).
Calculate gravitational force component along the slope F = 5mg sin(30°).
Calculate frictional force f' = μN' = 3.75mg cos(30°).
The friction force of block A on the slope is approximately 3.25mg.
